citations.narrative:
The facility's housing does not contain all birds securely and a male Indian Peafowl has gone missing. The facility had five
(5) free-ranging peafowl until February 3, 2025, when a male peafowl could not be found for daily observations. Staff
continued to search the entire grounds daily for several days but never found the bird or evidence of what happened.
Facilities that do not contain the birds securely or restrict other animals from entering can negatively affect the welfare of
the birds within such as animals escaping, being predated upon, injured, etc. Correct by 28 July 2025 by ensuring that
housing facilities for birds are designed and constructed so that they protect the birds from injury, restrict other animals
from entering, and contain the birds securely in accordance with 3.150(a).

The facility has not documented their required annual reviews of the Contingency Plan. Contingency plans must be in
place and reviewed annually to ensure it adequately addresses the criteria listed in paragraph (a) of this section and is still
relevant to the facility and animals. The plan must provide for the humane handling, treatment, transportation, housing,
and care of their animals in the event of an emergency or disaster. Correct by 4 August 2025 by reviewing the facility's
contingency plan at least once a year and by maintaining documentation of the review including any updates.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the farm manager.
